GOVERNMENT)SECRETCP.(50) 252COPY NO.2ND NOVEMBER, 1950CABINETEXPORTS OF COALNote by the Chancellor of the exchequer at recent meetings the Production Committee have considered two memoranda by the Minister of Fuel and Power oncirculated to the Cabinet as CP. (50) 255 and CP. (50) 256. Withthe exception of the representative of the Foreign Office the membersof the Production Committee agreed (a) that in order to avoid a fuelcrisis it was necessary to reduce exports of coal and bunkers by50,000 tons a week during November and December, 1950; (b) that the incidence of this reduction should fall on the countries of destinationin the manner shown in Annex A to CP. (50) 256; and (c) that theMinister of Fuel and Power should have discretion to authorise the refusal of export licences, subject to consultation on the official level and to a further report to the Committee in the event of suchrefusals seeming likely to reach an appreciable scale.coal supplies during the winter 1950/51.
